New Records: Australia won their 6th ODI World Cup title.
Travis Head became the 7th batter to score a hundred in a World Cup final.
Virat Kohli finished the World Cup with a record-shattering 765 runs.
Mohammed Shami finished as the leading wicket-taker in the 2023 World Cup.
Key Match Events: Australia defeated India by 6 wickets to win the World Cup.
Travis Head scored 137 runs in the final.
India's batters failed to put up a fight after Australia captain Pat Cummins won the toss and chose to bowl.
Rohit Sharma scored a rapid 47 runs.
KL Rahul hit only one four in a 107-ball 66.
Jasprit Bumrah struck twice off successive overs to remove Mitchell Marsh and Steve Smith.
Travis Head and Marnus Labuschagne formed a crucial partnership to ensure Australia's victory.
Pre-Game Insights: India were red-hot favourites to win the tournament after 10 successive victories.
Indian fans were eyeing revenge for the 2003 ODI World Cup final defeat against Australia.
Post-Match Reflections: India would be disappointed with their performance in the final but they should be proud of what they achieved in the run-up to the title clash.
India won 10 successive matches and two of their batters finished on top of the charts for the leading runs-scorers.
Virat Kohli finished with 765 runs from 11 matches while Rohit Sharma was second with 597 runs.
Jasprit Bumrah also finished with 20 wickets.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pat Cummins's decision to bowl first after winning the toss raised a few eyebrows.
India's body language on the field was poor.
The pitch was slow but it was by no means a bad cricket surface.
